page.title: 07CROPS
page.content: Approximately 75% of the land surveyed is put to arable use. In 1985 by far the greater part of this area was used to grow wheat. There were also large fields of barley, a smaller amount of oats and a considerable amount of oil-seed rape. There was also one large field of peas. One large farm in the block has at the present time no permanent workers but is managed, along with several other farms in the county, by a large company. A gang of workers from Humberside descends periodically to plough, sow, spray and harvest. However, plans are afoot to re-establish a permanent workforce in a collection of which are at the moment empty and half derelict.
